titleproper.value:
Guide to the Myron Golden Photograph Collection
                    <lb/> 1950's
                    <lb/>
                    <num>PR 303</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Susan Kriete

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2013-12-03T15:25-0500</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: This collection consists of approximately 100 photographs and negatives depicting buildings and people in New York City in the 1950's.

p.value: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org. Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

This collection is comprised of approximately 50 gelatin silver prints depicting people and buildings in New York City in the 1950's. The collection also includes some of the negatives for these prints, as well as additional negatives for which there is no print. Subjects include chess players, kids, businesses, an outdoor art show, the Polo Grounds, fishing on the piers, billboards, and other New York City scenes. Also included are a few photographs that were apparently taken outside of New York City.
